title: Priestley space
summary: In mathematics, a Priestley space is an ordered topological space with special properties. Priestley spaces are named after Hilary Priestley who introduced and investigated them.[1] Priestley spaces play a fundamental role in the study of distributive lattices. In particular, there is a duality ("Priestley duality"[2]) between the category of Priestley spaces and the category of bounded distributive lattices.[3][4]
